newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian UES talks with Irkutskenergo on merger.
newsitem.headline: Russian UES talks with Irkutskenergo on merger.

text.p: Russia's national power company Unified Energy System (UES) is in talks with Siberia-based Irkutskenergo on a merger, Russian news agencies quoted UES chief executive Boris Brevnov as saying on Thursday.
"Brevnov said UES is holding talks at the moment with Siberian (power) company Irkutskenergo on incorporating it into a single energy system," Interfax said.
The two companies are considering what to do with 39 percent of Irkutskenergo shares held by local government authorities, Brevnov said.
"We hope to reach a compromise with Irkutskenergo over that packet of shares (39 percent). This question will be solved this summer," Brevnov told reporters.

Irkutskenergo is the only Russian regional power companies which is not controlled by UES. It has quarrelled with UES over ownership of power stations, and Irkutskenergo's plans to export excess energy to Mongolia.
